enum.name: ArcIntentHandlerDestinationPlatform
enum.summary: Defines ARC intent handler platforms to continue the navigation.

int.label: Failure w/ default flow being skipped w/ proxy
Success w/ default flow being skipped w/ proxy
Number of logical is larger than possible
Unexpected data format in PSI CPU file
Fail to parse PSI CPU values
Unexpected data format in PSI Memory file
Unexpected numeric format in PSI Memory file
Fail to parse PSI Memory values

enum.name: ChromeOSPlatformVerificationResult2
enum.summary: Possible results of a platform verification attempt. See chrome/browser/ash/attestation/platform_verification.h.

enum.name: ChromeOSProcessTypeCollectionStatus

int.label: PS command errored during process types collection

enum.int: Process types couldn't be collected as PS command errored.

int.label: PS command errored during thread types collection

enum.int: Thread types couldn't be collected as PS command errored.
Process type parsing returned empty output.
Thread type parsing returned empty output.
Process types were partially collected.
Thread types were partially collected.
Process types were completely collected.
Thread types were completely collected.

enum.name: ChromeOSProfileCollectionStatus
enum.int: Profile was collected successfully.

int.label: Collection timer triggered but buffer is full

enum.int: Profile timer triggered but the collector's buffer is full.

int.label: Collection timer triggered but incognito window active

enum.int: Profile timer triggered but an incognito window was open.
Profile was collected but an incognito window was opened during the collection.
Profile data was collected and sent to Chrome as a serialized protobuf but it could not be deserialized by Chrome.
The profile data sent back to Chrome is invalid.
Another profile collection was already active.
Collection could not start due to failing prerequisites.
Failure while collecting data.
The profile session has zero samples.

enum.name: ChromeOSProfileRecordStatus
enum.int: Profile data was not recorded since metric recording is disabled.
Profile data was redacted since the profile manager used to obtain user profile(s) is unset.

int.label: No loaded user profile is found

enum.int: Profile data was redacted since there is no user profile initialized. When looking at user profile(s), the Default profile in Chrome OS is skipped.
Profile data was redacted since App Sync is disabled.
Profile data was recorded in full since App Sync is enabled.
Profile data was redacted since sync service is unavailable.
Profile data was redacted since Chrome sync feature is disabled.
Profile data was redacted since Chrome App Sync is disabled.

int.label: Chrome OS sync feature is disabled

enum.int: Profile data was redacted since Chrome OS sync feature is disabled.

int.label: Chrome OS App Sync is disabled

enum.int: Profile data was redacted since Chrome OS App Sync is disabled.

enum.name: ChromeOSSamlApiError
enum.summary: Different errors that can occur while using Credentials Passing API in ChromeOS.
enum.int: IdP sent unsupported key type
Gaia wanted to create an account while feature is not supported
Gaia wanted to create an account for a user that wasn't added.
IdP confirmed token that wasn't added
IdP sent a message that isn't supported in SAML API.
IdP didn't send user's password confirmation

enum.name: ChromeOSSamlApiUsed
enum.summary: ChromeOS login flow by Identity Provider. Can be either GAIA-based, SAML with API or pure SAML with password scraping.

int.label: SAML Chrome Credentials Passing API used
SAML Chrome Credentials Passing API not used

enum.name: ChromeOSSamlIncorrectAttestation
enum.summary: Different method that can repport Incorrect Attestation in SamlHandler in ChromeOS.
enum.int: SamlHandler repport Incorrect Attestation in onBeforeRequest_.
SamlHandler repport Incorrect Attestation in onBeforeSendHeaders_.
SamlHandler repport Incorrect Attestation in continueDelayedRedirect_.

enum.name: ChromeOSSamlProvider
enum.summary: Different SAML providers that uses SAML login flow in ChromeOS.

enum.name: ChromeOSSharesheetAction
enum.summary: Defines Chrome OS sharesheet actions.

int.label: Cancelled by user clicking outside bubble
Cancelled by user pressing Esc key

enum.name: ChromeOSSharesheetLaunchSource
enum.summary: The source from which sharesheet is invoked.

int.label: Invoked from the share button in the Files app
Invoked from the context menu in the Files app
Invoked from ARC++ to directly trigger Nearby Share
Invoked through the omnibox entry point

enum.name: ChromeOSSharesheetMimeType
enum.summary: The mime types of the content the user is trying to share from the sharesheet.

enum.name: ChromeOSUsbDeviceClass
enum.summary: https://www.usb.org/defined-class-codes

int.label: 480 Mbps fallback (USB 2.0 fallen back from SuperSpeed)
Failed because DLC Service was busy too many times
Will retry because DLC Service was busy
Failed because DLC Service returned an error code (see separate DLC error code histogram)
Failed because of an unknown DLC Service failure
Failed because DLC Service returned an error code (see separate DLC error code histogram)
Device is eligible for this feature. Recorded periodically.
Feature is enabled by user. Recorded periodically.
Successful attempt to use the feature. Recorded on each event.
Failed attempt to use the feature. Recorded on each event.
Feature is accessible to user. Recorded periodically.

enum.name: HardwareVerifierQualificationStatus
enum.summary: List of the possible qualification status of a component. This is defined in https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/platform2/+/refs/heads/main/hardware_verifier/proto/hardware_verifier.proto (enum QualificationStatus).
enum.int: Unqualified
Rejected
Qualified
No_Match

enum.name: HaTSSurvey
enum.summary: Possible survey states and answers for each question.

int.label: Multiple YUV streams of different aspect ratio
Multiple YUV streams of different aspect ratio with BLOB

enum.name: IntentPickerDialogAction
enum.summary: Defines actions taken by the user in the Intent Picker dialog

enum.name: KcerError
enum.summary: List of errors generated by the Kcer component.

enum.name: KcerPkcs12ImportEvent
enum.summary: Events related to KcerChapsUtil processing PKCS#12 Import.

enum.name: KcerPkcs12MigrationUmaEvent
enum.summary: Events related to the migration of PKCS#12 Import.

enum.name: KeyboardTopRowActionKeys
enum.summary: List of possible keyboard top-row action keys. This is defined in ui/events/ash/keyboard_capability.h (enum TopRowActionKey).

enum.name: KeyboardTopRowLayoutWithExtraSublayout
enum.summary: List of possible top-row layouts for keyboards, including an additional sub-layout. This is defined in ui/events/ash/keyboard_info_metrics.h (enum KeyboardTopRowLayoutForMetric).

enum.name: LanguagePackDlcErrorType
enum.summary: List of all the error types that DLC Service returns.

enum.name: LanguagePackFeatureIds
enum.summary: List of all the Features that are supported by Language Packs. A Feature is a synonym for client.

enum.name: LanguagePackFeatureSuccess
enum.summary: Multidimension Enum that captures success and failures broken down by Feature ID. We use this approach based on the Histograms guidelines to represent a MxN matrix.

enum.name: LanguagePackLanguageCodes
enum.summary: Hash values of language codes that correspond to a Language Pack. The hash is created by computing base::PersistentHash() of the label, then cast to int32. To generate new values in a way that is consistent, use the unit test at chromeos/ash/components/language/language_packs/metrics_unittest.cc.

enum.name: LinkCapturingEvent
enum.summary: Defines events in the link capturing user flow

enum.name: NetworkAnnotationHashCodes
enum.summary: Hash codes mapping to Chrome Network Annotation IDs. More info can be found at tools/traffic_annotation/scripts/auditor/README.md.

enum.name: OwnerKeyUmaEvent
enum.int: DeviceSettingsService was null, owner key was not loaded.
Managed device successfully loaded the public owner key.
Managed device failed to load the public owner key.
Consumer owner user successfully loaded both public and private keys.
Consumer owner received both public and private keys, but at least one of them wasn't actually loaded.
ChromeOS decided to establish consumer ownership when there was no existing public key.
ChromeOS decided to establish consumer ownership when there was an existing public key.
ChromeOS decided to re-generate the lost owner key based on the data from device policies after the public key was found (the private part is what was lost).
ChromeOS decided to re-generate the lost owner key based on the data from device policies and the public key was also not found. (Strictly speaking not a failure, but still an unusual situation).
A user was categorized as not an owner based on the data from device policies, the public key was successfully loaded.
A user was categorized as not an owner based on the data from device policies, the public key failed to load.
ChromeOS decided to re-generate the lost owner key based on the data from local state and the public key was not present.

ChromeOS decided to re-generate the lost owner key based on the data from local state after the public key was found (in such a case device policies should be used, relying on local state is unexpected).
A user was categorized as not an owner based on the data from local state, the public key was successfully loaded.
A user was categorized as not an owner based on the data from local state, the public key failed to load.
ChromeOS assumed that a user is not an owner based on the lack of data, the public key was successfully loaded.
ChromeOS assumed that a user is not an owner based on the lack of data, the public key failed to load.
New owner key was generated on the first attempt.
New owner key was generated after 1+ failures.
Failed to generate new owner key, at least the old public key was returned.
Failed to generate new owner key, the old public key also failed to load (or was not present).
Successfully started signing policies.
Failed to start signing policies.
Successfully signed policies.
Failed to sign policies.
Successfully stored policies.
Failed to store policies.
A user was categorized as not an owner based on the user type, the public key was successfully loaded.
A user was categorized as not an owner based on the user type, the public key failed to load.
A user was categorized as not an owner because the user name was empty, this is not expected to happen, the public key was successfully loaded.
A user was categorized as not an owner because the user name was empty, this is not expected to happen, the public key failed to load.
ChromeOS decided to establish consumer ownership when there was no indication that it's the first user, but also no public key, no policies and no local state entry.
ChromeOS successfully generated the owner key in the private slot.
ChromeOS failed to generate the owner key in the private slot.
ChromeOS successfully generated the owner key in the public slot.
ChromeOS failed to generate the owner key in the public slot.
ChromeOS started migrating the owner key from the public to the private slot (the outcome is collected as kOwnerKeyGenerated and other counters).
ChromeOS started migrating the owner key from the private to the public slot (the outcome is collected as kOwnerKeyGenerated and other counters).
session_manager notified Chrome that it finished saving the owner key successfully.
session_manager notified Chrome that it failed to save the owner key on disk.
ChromeOS started deleting the old owner key.
The owner key was found in the public.
The owner key was found in the private slot.

int.label: User has no choice since all open ports are only on one side
Left: second partner (same side with first)
Left: second partner (opposite side to first)
Right: second partner (same side with first)
Right: second partner (opposite side to first)
User has no choice since all ports are only on one side
Left: first connection during a session
Left: same side with previous connection
Left: opposite side from previous connection
Right: first connectoin during a session
Right: same side with previous connection
Right: opposite side with previous connection
Launch Printer settings from empty state button
Launch Printer settings from header button

enum.name: SamlInSessionPasswordChangeEvent
enum.summary: Track how often we try to guide users through the in-session flow to change their SAML password, and how often they complete the flow.

int.label: In-session PW-change manager enabled and created.
User notified that password will soon expire.
User notified urgently: password will soon expire.
User notified urgently: password already expired.
User acknowledges and begins change password flow.
SAML password is changed during in-session flow.
Password scraping succeeds during in-session change.
Password scraping partial success - 1 password only.
Password scraping fails - no passwords scraped.
Cryptohome password changed using scraped passwords.
Cryptohome password changed using retyped passwords.
Cryptohome change failed: wrong password scraped.
Cryptohome change failed: wrong password retyped.

enum.name: SamlInSessionPasswordSyncEvent
enum.summary: Track how often we call password sync token API and records its result.

int.label: Start of sync token validation polling in-session.
Start of sync token validation polling on the login screen.
API error: wrong server response code.
API error: incorrect serlialized response data.
API error: no sync token in Create response.
API error: no sync token in Get response.
Failed to read boot params file
Cache miss but filled from procfs
Device XDR reporting policy was checked at startup (baseline)
XDR reporting was enabled by Device policy
Writable+executable mount found in the init mount namespace (deprecated)
Writable+executable mount found in the init mount namespace, on or under /usr/local (this suggests a dev image)
Writable+executable mount found in the init mount namespace, not on, nor under, /usr/local
Successful create_memfd syscall detected in the audit log file. (Baseline for memfd execution attempt).
Memfd execution attempt detected in the audit log file.

enum.name: WebApkInstallResultChromeOS
enum.int: Installed successfully.
Installation failed because the app was in an invalid state (e.g., it had no suitable icon).
Installation failed because the ARC system was not available.
Update was cancelled because the existing WebAPK was found to be up-to-date.
Updating failed because there was an error while fetching information about the existing WebAPK from ARC.
The network request to the WebAPK server failed with an error.
The network request to the WebAPK server timed out.
Installing the WebAPK through Google Play failed with an error.
